Highly engaged and vibrant community of cloud practitioners

The Open Alliance for Cloud Adoption is amember-ledconsortium ofglobal technology organizationsdedicated to easing adoption ofinteroperablesolutions and services addressingcloud computingfor enterprises across the globe.

About OACA

The OACA is a community-led Linux Foundation project to enable innovative, safe and agile use of cloud computing for business value.

OACA is driven by the mission to share cloud adoption practices and continuously improve the maturity, safety, and scale of cloud adoption.

Our goal is to create a highly engaged and vibrant community of cloud practitioners collaborating to driver interoperability of practices and value.

What the OACA Does

Content development

to ease adoption of hybrid IT and cloud for IT service modernization

Cloud Maturity Model (CMM)

Enabling inter-enterprise benchmarking and enterprise IT self-evaluation

Cloud Adoption User Stories

from contributors showing how specific enterprises have adopted services in private, public, and hybrid cloud models

Usage Guides

to capture common requirements, adoption patterns, and architectures

White Papers

addressing issues and surfacing Best Practices in a range of domains

Webinars, Videos, and Podcasts

to communicate OACA content and messages into diverse channels

Influence Standards, Regulatory, and Legislative bodies

Identify opportunities for safter cloud adoption through consistent regulatory influence

OACA Cloud Maturity Model (CMM)

Maturing your organization to innovative, safe and agile use of cloud computing

A cloud maturity model (CMM) helps to answer the question "What should our journey to cloud and hybrid IT look like?" With a CMM, and organization can analyze its current state and plan the implementation of cloud technologies. With business objectives as a parameter, the CMM defines a target state and then provides the keys to performing a gap analysis.
